intro: Dorema sabulosum var. borszczowii, commonly known as the Borszczowii sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly found in Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, appearing in clusters and blooming in the summer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in steppes and desert margins.
